com.ibm.xmi.framework
Interface Factory

All Known Implementing Classes:
FactoryAdapter
public interface Factory

The purpose of this interface is to provide an API for the framework so it can create implementations of the Data hierarchy interfaces when loading XMI files.

The FactoryAdapter class implements this interface and creates the the framework's implementation classes for the Data hierarchy interfaces.

If you want to create your own implementation classes or subclass the framework's implementation classes, you can implement this interface yourself, and register an instance of your implementation with the framework using the FactoryRegister class.

Since there are many methods in this interface, it is probably easier for you to subclass the FactoryAdapter class rather than implement this interface from scratch, unless you need to implement most of the methods in this interface yourself.

Method Summary
 Datatype makeDatatype(java.lang.Object container, java.lang.String xmiName)
          Makes a Java object of a class that implements the Datatype interface, adds it to the container package, and sets its name to the given XMI name.
 Enum makeEnum(java.lang.Object container, java.lang.String xmiName, java.util.Iterator literals)
          Makes a Java object of a class that implements the Enum Interface, adds it to the container package, sets its name to the given XMI name, and sets its literals using the literals parameter.

          This method makes the given subclass a subclass of the given superclass by adding the subclass to the superclass and adding the superclass to the subclass, if the subclass and superclass implement the XMIClass interface.

          Makes a Java object of a class that implements the Package interface, adds it to the given container package, and sets its XMI name to the given one.

makeInheritance
